FAQ.question: What are Registered Document Details?
FAQ.answer: They are official records of a property document registered at the Sub-Registrar Office, including document type, parties involved, extent, and registration data.

FAQ.question: What details are required to fetch registered document details through JaaGa?
FAQ.answer: You only need Tahsildar & Jt. Registrar Office, Document Number, and Registration Year.

FAQ.question: What information is included in the registered document details?
FAQ.answer: Document type, buyer and seller names, survey/location details, execution date, registration number, SRO office, and nature of transaction.

FAQ.question: Does this provide a certified copy of the document?
FAQ.answer: No. It provides details for verification. You can request a certified copy separately through JaaGa.

FAQ.question: Can this verify if a document is legally registered?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it confirms if the document exists and is recorded in the SRO database.

FAQ.question: Is this the same as EC?
FAQ.answer: No. EC shows transaction history and encumbrances, while registered document details show the specifics of a single document.

FAQ.question: Can I verify buyer and seller names?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Registered document details include parties involved as per government records.

FAQ.question: Does this show survey and land measurements?
FAQ.answer: It shows survey/location details mentioned in the document, but not detailed measurement maps.

FAQ.question: Is this legally valid?
FAQ.answer: It is valid for verification, but certified copies are required for official submissions like banks or legal cases.

FAQ.question: Is the data from JaaGa authentic?
FAQ.answer: Yes. All information is retrieved directly from official government portals without modification.
